messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Joylyn <joylyn1@...> wrote:
>
> We've just tie dyed most of our socks. If you want a matched set,
you can look hard and find one that sorta matches, or if you are lucky
the one that really does match. Other than that, they all look good.
I get a lot of positive comments on my tie dyed socks. So do the girls.
>
> Joylyn

this is great! my oldest dd lucia 21y is totally into spinning and has
started to dye her batts...what fun! Im inspired! THANKYOU!
melissa
in italy
mamma of 7 kids and
2 bushels of socks lol

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:  socks,
messages.msgSnippet: You are so right ;)  I actually mentioned this to Zac - that we could just take a clean (LOL) sock with us when we go out.  I m pretty sure we got them at
messages.messageBody:
You are so right ;) I actually mentioned this to Zac - that we could just take a clean (LOL) sock with us when we go out. I'm pretty sure we got them at Target - so that is at least a starting point.

Lisa W.



----- Original Message -----
From: Sandra Dodd
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, July 11, 2008 9:34 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: socks,


-=-Yes ! I just wrote socks on the "to buy" list - Zac's so specific
about his clothing I wrote a complete description of his socks on the
list so I can be sure and purchase more of the exact same ones.-=-

If you took a sock with you and showed it to a store employee they'd
be glad to try to find the same ones!

Sandra

messages.subject: socks, was Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: I am lol-ing at all these sock posts!  What a joy to get a glimpse into the lives of my fellow list mates.  I can just see the sock baskets by the dryers, the
messages.messageBody:
I am lol-ing at all these sock posts! What a joy to get a glimpse
into the lives of my fellow list mates. I can just see the sock
baskets by the dryers, the Sharpie marked socks, the tie-dyed socks,
the hundreds of superfluous socks...

I was so inspired I bought everyone (including me) a great big new
package of socks today.

I will keep this thread in mind the next time I discover the socks
under the couch right AFTER I finished all the laundry. Life's too
short to stress about socks. Or even underwear.

Jennie

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/11/2008 12:26:28 PM Eastern Daylight Time, birthmamma@mac.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/11/2008 12:26:28 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
birthmamma@... writes:

<<<I too keep a "sock basket" on the dryer for any loners. I have had a
mate show up years later! Where DO they go?!>>>




I've kept a basket, and currently a bag of them. I use the holey ones for
dusting and cleaning (over my hand, like Sandra mentioned). There's a
*wonderful* story about where lost socks go (and buttons and other such things) in a
collective book of cat stories by different authors called Cat Fantastic,
Andre Norton being one of the authors on the cover. (ISBN-13: 9780886773557) They
now have sequels (2 up to at least 5) that I haven't read, but that one is
super and I re-read it often. Ah! That particular story is by Donna Farley and
is called "It must be someplace". (Funny, when I asked Wyl if he knew where
the book was he said, "Oh, you mean the one with the story about the lost
socks?!" LOL)

Peace,
De

messages.subject: socks, was Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: We ve just tie dyed  most of our socks.  If you want a matched set, you can look hard and find one that sorta matches, or if you are lucky the one that really
messages.messageBody:
We've just tie dyed most of our socks. If you want a matched set, you can look hard and find one that sorta matches, or if you are lucky the one that really does match. Other than that, they all look good. I get a lot of positive comments on my tie dyed socks. So do the girls.

Joylyn

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/11/2008 5:49:59 AM Eastern Daylight Time, melissa.dietrick@gmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/11/2008 5:49:59 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
melissa.dietrick@... writes:

<<<And make sure that you dont get different
sized sock in similar colours. Lorenzo dh found a bargain on organic
white socks once in 4 different sizes (we have friends in the
business) and those socks just sit there, never getting paired as it
is so difficult to sort them out by size shape (some are short some
long, some plain some with ribbing) and no colours. >>>




We've found colored sharpies, here. Sometimes we put an initial on a toe,
sometimes a smilie face on an ankle, sometimes a dot on the heel. With 9,
everyone could have their own color. I even went so far, once, as to number all my
pairs ( a left and right #1, a left and right #2, etc.) so that I would have
matching socks with the same amount of wear and discoloration on them. That
proved to be too much, so we just mark them for owners, now.

Peace,
De

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Every few months, Logan will sort the socks because it s something he likes to do and we get rid of all the ones that no longer have matches (where do they
messages.messageBody:
-=-Every few months, Logan will sort the socks because it's something
he likes
to do and we get rid of all the ones that no longer have matches
(where do
they go??? <g>)-=-

I have a basket of singles. Sometimes a sock emerges from a longtime
hidey-hole (sometimes one is up in the corner of a fitted sheet that
was folded and put in the closet, or behind the washing machine, or
up under someone's bed) and we can find its mate. Sometimes I use
those for dust-mitts or for wiping something really greasy and then
just throwing them away (ceiling fan in the kitchen--409 spray and
socks on my hands), or maybe washing them and putting them back in
the single socks basket.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: "What was I thinking" was Telling our kids the answe...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/11/2008 10:43:15 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, Sandra@SandraDodd.com writes: Holly  said recently that she didn t mind if we shared socks.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/11/2008 10:43:15 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,
Sandra@... writes:

Holly said recently that she didn't mind if we shared socks. There
are some of mine too big for her and some of hers too small for me,
but there's an overlapping set of socks we snag as needed


_____

The nightstand beside my bed is our family sock drawer. Brenna, Logan and I
all wear the same size...all white lowcut sport socks. Broc's are twice the
size of the rest. The socks just get thrown into the drawer and when anyone
needs a pair they rummage through and find a pair that may or may not match.
I like mine to match.

Every few months, Logan will sort the socks because it's something he likes
to do and we get rid of all the ones that no longer have matches (where do
they go??? <g>)

Right now, they are all matched up which I find is a sign of our typical
summers ...Not so many places we need to get to so we have time for doing a few
more jigsaw puzzles and organizing our sock drawer.
Gail

http://gail-hummingbirdhaven.blogspot.com/
